page.title: 08A RETIRED GENTLEMAN
page.content: MR EVERET IS RETIRED AFTER A LIFE IN THE MERCHANT NAVY. HE AND HIS WIFE LIVE AT UPPER OLD MILL FARM, AN EXTENDED BUNGALOW SURROUNDED BY WOODLAND AT THE END OF A TWO MILE ROUGH TRACK. HE ENJOYS LOOKING AFTER HIS GEESE AND LOOKING AFTER THE REMOTE PROPERTY WHICH IS NOT ACCESSIBLE TO MAINS WATER OR DRAINAGE. HIS WATER SUPPLY IS PUMPED FROM A CONTAMINATED WELL AND MUST BE BOILED BEFORE BEING CONSUMED. THE WATER IS STORED IN LARGE BARRELS, OPEN TO CATCH THE RAIN WATER. ANOTHER PROBLEM IS THE THREAT TO HIS LIVESTOCK FROM FOXES. MR EVERET AND HIS WIFE ENJOY DOCUMENTARY ITEMS BOTH ON RADIO AND TELEVISION. MR EVERET LIKES TO OBSERVE ALL FORM OF NATURAL HISTORY. HE IS ANXIOUS ABOUT THE FUTURE FOR YOUNG PEOPLE IN VIEW OF THE INCREASING PROBLEMS OF UNEMPLOYMENT AND CRIME.
